Issues.Title: Accessibility - Narrator down arrow in Scan mode disallows skipping a disabled hyperlink
Issues.Body:
Copied from [VSO 20338011](https://microsoft.visualstudio.com/OS/_workitems/edit/20338011)


Feedback Details | Description
-- | --
Title | Narrator down arrow in Scan mode gets stuck in a disabled hyperlink
Description | - Run https://aka.ms/ke to install Kusto Explorer (Press Open when asked)- Switch to scan mode to read the dialog that comes up "Accept End User Licencing Agreement"- Beside the fact that the focus is a little off, when the focus is on the hyperlink "Your agreement", it got stuck. Narrator keeps saying "Your agreement" each time Down arrow is pressed.
User Impact | - When Narrator’s scan mode is used on a WPF RichTextBox that includes a disabled hyperlink the user would expect that after landing on the hyperlink arrow-key down should navigate to the text after the hyperlink, instead repeatedly pressing arrow-down key will always prompt narrator to announce the hyperlink. If the user simply lets Narrator finish reading the hyperlink’s text he or she can press arrow-down key and move to the next part of the text
Work Around | - If the user waits for Narrator to finish reading the hyperlink’s text, he or she can then press arrow-down key and Narrator’s focus will go to the text after as expected
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility - Narrator down arrow in Scan mode disallows skipping a disabled hyperlink" (#1662)

Issues.Title: XAML References to Microsoft.Windows.Themes failing to build in Preview 8
Issues.Body:
.NET Core 3.0 Preview 8

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Updating to Preview 8 broke our build that was working with Preview 7.  At least some references to items in PresentationFramework.Aero (such as Microsoft.Windows.Themes.SystemDropShadowChrome) cause the build to fail with errors like:
`The tag 'SystemDropShadowChrome' does not exist in XML namespace 'clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero'`
 
 **Minimal repro:**
 Add a reference to SystemDropShadowChrome in the `dotnet new wpf` template:

```xml
<Window x:Class="temp_wpf.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:temp_wpf"
        xmlns:themes="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">
    <Grid>
        <themes:SystemDropShadowChrome><Button>Hello</Button></themes:SystemDropShadowChrome>
    </Grid>
</Window>

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "XAML References to Microsoft.Windows.Themes failing to build in Preview 8" (#1655)

Issues.Title: It is not possible to integrate WPF with ASP.NET
Issues.Body:
(Adopted from #437 since this is still an issue.)

- .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview8-013656
- Windows version: 1809
- Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

**Problem description:**
I want to create web application which will be hosted by the WPF application. In order to that, I create separate web project and add reference to it from the WPF application. When I attempt to build

**Actual behavior:**
> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview8-013656\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(243,9): error MC1000: Unknown build error, 'Could not find assembly 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Core, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60'. Either explicitly load this assembly using a method such as LoadFromAssemblyPath() or use a MetadataAssemblyResolver that returns a valid assembly.' 

**Expected behavior:**
Build just runs.

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create WPF 3.0 app wpf30
2. Create ASP.NET 3.0 app aspnet30
3. Add aspnet30 project as reference to wpf30
4. Build
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "It is not possible to integrate WPF with ASP.NET" (#1654)

Issues.Title: Invalid comparison in MSBuild's ignore-conditions mode in outer build of multitargeted project
Issues.Body:
Originally reported by @batzen at https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/12267#issuecomment-522067627

* .NET Core Version: `3.0.100-preview9-013744`
* Windows version: `10.0.18362.239`
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 **Problem description:**

A multitargeted WPF project throws an exception when evaluated in MSBuild's "ignore conditions" mode, which is often used in design-time scenarios.

This is because while the conditions here are sufficient at build time for real projects, when conditions are ignored MSBuild thinks the project is invalid (microsoft/msbuild#4622)

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/d6c7ae5e7034fb19cc60d4ead2ea92b3210e6b83/packaging/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.props#L98-L121

**Actual behavior:** 

```
error: A numeric comparison was attempted on "$(_TargetFrameworkVersionWithoutV)" that evaluates to "" instead of a number, in condition "'$(_TargetFrameworkVersionWithoutV)' >= '4.5'".  c:\program files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview8-013656\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.props
```
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
No error

 **Minimal repro:**
 
- dotnet new wpf
- Replace `TargetFramework` with `<TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.0;net45</TargetFrameworks>`
- dotnet restore
- dotnet list package
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Invalid comparison in MSBuild's ignore-conditions mode in outer build of multitargeted project" (#1651)

Issues.Title: Everything is dynamic with WPF Net Core 3.0, C#, DynamicExpresso, .Net Standard and Azure Cosmos Db
Issues.Body:
Dear Team, This is just for information that I am trying to create everything dynamic application by using WPF Net Core 3.0, C#, DynamicExpresso, .Net Standard and Azure Cosmos Db. My questions about performance and best practice for below scenario:

1. For master page: Dynamically create CRUD operation in code behind or by using coding.
2. Multi-models Page: Dynamically create multi-model page in tabs.
3. Wizard Page: Dynamically create wizard page with multi-model operations.

I tried the same and working fine but I am worried about performance and any disadvantage for using such type of dynamic scenario.

Please suggest !!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Everything is dynamic with WPF Net Core 3.0, C#, DynamicExpresso, .Net Standard and Azure Cosmos Db" (#1649)

Issues.Title: Re-add WindowsFormsApplicationBase usage
Issues.Body:
One of our tests has a class that should implement `WindowsFormsApplicationBase`. Currently this type is not ported to .NET Core, so we have temporarily removed its usage. Once this type is ported, re-add it to the `WinformsApp` class that is defined in `src\Test\ElementServices\FeatureTests\Untrusted\Threading\SynchronizationContextModel.cs`.

Here is an [internal PR](https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_git/dotnet-wpf-test/pullrequest/2675?_a=overview) with more info.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Re-add WindowsFormsApplicationBase usage" (#1642)

Issues.Title: WPF SDK should explicitly contribute WPF ProjectCapability
Issues.Body:
Currently the WPF SDK does not contribute the "WPF" ProjectCapability. It is contributed by [Microsoft.Managed.DesignTime.targets](https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/blob/master/src/Microsoft.VisualStudio.ProjectSystem.Managed/ProjectSystem/DesignTimeTargets/Microsoft.Managed.DesignTime.targets) but that does not apply outside of VS.

The ProjectCapability should be explicitly contributed by the SDK, so that proper detection of project type can be done outside of VS.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF SDK should explicitly contribute WPF ProjectCapability" (#1638)

Issues.Title: SystemDropShadowChrome does not exist in [..] PresentationFramework.Aero
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview8-013656
* Windows version: Win10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
 
 **Problem description:**

 Since VS updated yesterday I receive the following exception which breaks building applications
 
 **Actual behavior:**
`Error	MC3074	The tag 'SystemDropShadowChrome' does not exist in XML namespace 'clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero'.`
 
 **Minimal repro:**

```
<ResourceDictionary
    xmlns:bla="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Themes;assembly=PresentationFramework.Aero">
 
<Popup>
    <bla:SystemDropShadowChrome
    </bla:SystemDropShadowChrome>
</Popup>

</ResourceDictionary>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SystemDropShadowChrome does not exist in [..] PresentationFramework.Aero" (#1637)
